ARABIC: أَلَآ إِنَّهُمْ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْسِدُونَ وَلَٰكِن لَّا يَشْعُرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No indeed! They are the corrupters, but they are not aware of it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Yet they are surely mischief-mongers, even though they do not know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Beware! they do spread disorder but they realize it not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They, certainly, are corrupt but do not realize it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Pay heed! It is they who are mischievous, but they do not have sense.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, they are the ones who make mischief, but they perceive not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Now surely they themselves are the mischief makers, but they do not perceive.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Truly, they are the workers of corruption but they are not aware.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Are not they indeed the mischief-makers? But they perceive not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: but it is they who are really causing corruption, though they do not realize it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Lo! verily it is they who are the corrupters, and yet they perceive not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Behold! They are themselves the agents of corruption, but they are not aware.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Of a surety, they are the ones who make mischief, but they realise (it) not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily! They are the ones who make mischief, but they perceive not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But it is they who are the evildoers, though they do not sense it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: In fact, they are the troublemakers, but they are not aware.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Unquestionably, it is they who are the corrupters, but they perceive [it] not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [2:12] Truly (a-lā, ‘truly’, is for alerting), intended emphatically, they are the agents of corruption, but they perceive, this, not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They are indeed the mischief mongers) by being a hindrance. (But they perceive not): the followers do not know that their leaders mislead them.
